00029 //========================================================================
00030 // Bitmap Utilities
00031 //
00032 // This code isn't discussed anywhere in the book, but you use it to 
00033 // take classic BMP files and copy/convert their bits to a direct draw
00034 // surface.

00042 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 // Name: Bitmap::GetRLEBitSize()
00044 // Desc: Get the size of a decoded RLE bitmap
00045 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 long Bitmap::GetRLEBitSize(const char* inputdata)
00047 {
00048         BITMAPFILEHEADER *bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *)inputdata;
00049         BITMAPINFOHEADER *bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00050 
00051         int width = bmpInfoHdr->biWidth;
00052         int height = bmpInfoHdr->biHeight;
00053 
00054         //
00055         // Manually decode RLE encoded 8 bit bitmaps.
00056         //
00057 
00058         //
00059         // Account for DWORD aligned scan lines
00060         //
00061 
00062         int offset=4-(width%4);
00063         if(offset==4)
00064         {
00065                 offset=0;
00066         }
00067 
00068         //
00069         // Hande right side up bitmaps
00070         //
00071 
00072         int lineCount=height;
00073         if(lineCount<0)
00074         {
00075                 lineCount=-lineCount;
00076         }
00077 
00078         //
00079         // Decode as follows:
00080         // If the first byte isn't 0, there's a run of that many bytes that
00081         // have a value of the next byte.
00082         //
00083         // If the first byte is 0, read the next byte.
00084         // If that byte is 0, it's the end of a scan line, advance to the next
00085         // scan line.
00086         // If that byte is 1, it's the end of the bitmap.
00087         // If that byte is 2, it's a forward jump into the bitmap. The next byte
00088         // is the horizontal jump, the byte after that is the vertial jump.
00089         //
00090         // If that byte is 3 or more is a list of literal byte values.
00091         // Copy that many bytes to the new scan line. These literal bytes
00092         // sections are word aligned so if the list ends mid-word, it's
00093         // padded with a 0.
00094         //
00095 
00096         return lineCount*(width+offset);
00097 }

00099 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00100 // Name: Bitmap::DecodeRLEBits()
00101 // Desc: Decodes a RLE bitmap
00102 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00103 void Bitmap::DecodeRLEBits(const char* inputdata, char* outputdata)
00104 {
00105         BITMAPFILEHEADER *bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *)inputdata;
00106 
00107         BITMAPINFOHEADER *bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00108         BITMAPINFO *bitmapInfo=(BITMAPINFO *)bmpInfoHdr;
00109 
00110         const char *bitmapBits=((const char *)bmf)+bmf->bfOffBits;
00111 
00112         int width = bmpInfoHdr->biWidth;
00113         int height = bmpInfoHdr->biHeight;
00114 
00115         //
00116         // Manually decode RLE encoded 8 bit bitmaps.
00117         //
00118 
00119         //
00120         // Account for DWORD aligned scan lines
00121         //
00122 
00123         int offset=4-(width % 4);
00124         if(offset==4)
00125         {
00126                 offset=0;
00127         }
00128 
00129         //
00130         // Hande right side up bitmaps
00131         //
00132 
00133         int lineCount=height;
00134         if(lineCount<0)
00135         {
00136                 lineCount=-lineCount;
00137         }
00138 
00139         //
00140         // Decode as follows:
00141         // If the first byte isn't 0, there's a run of that many bytes that
00142         // have a value of the next byte.
00143         //
00144         // If the first byte is 0, read the next byte.
00145         // If that byte is 0, it's the end of a scan line, advance to the next
00146         // scan line.
00147         // If that byte is 1, it's the end of the bitmap.
00148         // If that byte is 2, it's a forward jump into the bitmap. The next byte
00149         // is the horizontal jump, the byte after that is the vertial jump.
00150         //
00151         // If that byte is 3 or more is a list of literal byte values.
00152         // Copy that many bytes to the new scan line. These literal bytes
00153         // sections are word aligned so if the list ends mid-word, it's
00154         // padded with a 0.
00155         //
00156 
00157         long size=lineCount*(width+offset);
00158         char *newBitmapBits=outputdata;
00159         const char *source=bitmapBits;
00160         char *dest=newBitmapBits;
00161         char *lineStart=dest;
00162         while(lineCount>0)
00163         {
00164                 char code=*source++;
00165                 if(code!=0)
00166                 {
00167                         const char value=*source++;
00168                         
00169                         /*for(int f=0;f<code;f++)
00170                         {
00171                                 *dest++=value;
00172                         }*/
00173                         //4 bytes at a time!
00174                         memset(dest, value, code);
00175                         dest += code;
00176                 }
00177                 else
00178                 {
00179                         code=*source++;
00180 
00181                         if (code==1)
00182                         {
00183                                 break;
00184                         }
00185 
00186                         switch(code)
00187                         {
00188                         case 0:
00189                                 lineStart+=width+offset;
00190                                 dest=lineStart;
00191                                 lineCount--;
00192                                 break;
00193                         case 1:
00194                                 break;
00195 
00196                         case 2:
00197                                 {
00198                                         BYTE horz=*source++;
00199                                         BYTE vert=*source++;
00200 
00201                                         if(vert!=0)
00202                                         {
00203                                                 int offset=(int)(dest-lineStart);
00204                                                 lineStart+=(width+offset)*vert;
00205                                                 dest=lineStart+offset;
00206                                                 lineCount-=vert;
00207                                         }
00208                                         dest+=horz;
00209                                 }
00210                                 break;
00211                         default:
00212                                 {
00213                                         /*for(int f=0;f<code;f++)
00214                                         {
00215                                                 *dest++=*source++;
00216                                         }*/
00217                                         //4 bytes at a time!
00218                                         memcpy(dest, source, code);
00219                                         dest += code;
00220                                         source += code;
00221 
00222                                         if(code&1)
00223                                         {
00224                                                 source++;
00225                                         }
00226                                 }
00227                                 break;
00228                         }
00229                 }
00230         }
00231 }

00233 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00234 // Name: Bitmap::GetFrameSize()
00235 // Desc: Retrieves the size needed for a buffer to hold a particular frame.
00236 //       Remember that multiple frames of animation are stored in a bitmap
00237 //       like a filmstrip. Since all the bitmaps for the animation are exactly 
00238 //       the same, only one BITMAPINFOHEADER is stored, and some offsets to the
00239 //       beginning of the bitmaps are stored in a lookup table at the beginning
00240 //       of the inputdata.
00241 //
00242 //       YES...this is non-standard. It's stored this way because there really 
00243 //       isn't a standard method to store multi-frame bitmaps.
00244 //
00245 //       Incidentally, this is how IPAC stores graphic data.
00246 //
00247 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00248 int Bitmap::GetFrameSize( const char* inputdata, int iFrame )
00249 {
00250         int datasize( 0 );
00251 
00252         // MLM 5-19-2001 This needed some defensive coding - found a weakness here
00253         // during a bug fix for #821
00254         assert(iFrame>=0 && _T("Frames must be > 0"));
00255         if (iFrame<0)
00256                 return NULL;
00257         // MLM 5-19-2001 End
00258         
00259         // The image is at the start of the buffer + the frame offset
00260         int* pOffset = (int*) inputdata;
00261         const char* pImage = inputdata + pOffset[iFrame];
00262 
00263         BITMAPFILEHEADER* bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) pImage;
00264         BITMAPINFOHEADER* bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00265         BITMAPINFO* bitmapInfo=(BITMAPINFO *)bmpInfoHdr;
00266         
00267         int headersize = sizeof( BITMAPFILEHEADER ) + sizeof( BITMAPINFOHEADER );
00268         
00269         datasize = headersize;
00270         
00271         long frameSize;
00272         long pitch;
00273         
00274         bool _8bit = bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount == 8;
00275         bool _RLE = _8bit && bmpInfoHdr->biCompression==BI_RLE8;
00276         
00277         // Calc size needed
00278         if ( _RLE )
00279         {
00280                 frameSize = GetRLEBitSize( pImage );
00281         }
00282         else
00283         {
00284                 pitch = ((((bmpInfoHdr->biWidth * bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount)+31)&~31)>>3);
00285                 frameSize = pitch*bmpInfoHdr->biHeight;
00286         }
00287         datasize += frameSize;
00288         
00289         // 8 bit has RGB quad data
00290         if ( _8bit )
00291                 datasize += sizeof( RGBQUAD ) * 256;
00292 
00293         return datasize;
00294 }
00295 
00296 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00297 // Name: Bitmap::GetSingleFrame()
00298 // Desc: Retrieves a single out of an IPAC file, decompressing it if necessary
00299 //               into the destination buffer.
00300 //
00301 // See comments for GetFrameSize to find out what the hell this does.
00302 // It is NOT normal for bitmaps to store multiple frames, and this routine reads
00303 // an extension of the BMP file format that is non-standard.
00304 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00305 void Bitmap::GetSingleFrame( const char* inputdata, int iFrame, char* destbuffer, int datasize )
00306 {
00307         // MLM 5-19-2001 This needed some defensive coding - found a weakness here
00308         // during a bug fix for #821
00309         assert(iFrame>=0 && _T("Frames must be > 0"));
00310         if (iFrame<0)
00311                 return;
00312         // MLM 5-19-2001 End
00313         
00314         // The image is at the start of the buffer + the frame offset
00315         int* pOffset = (int*) inputdata;
00316         const char* pImage = inputdata + pOffset[iFrame];
00317 
00318         BITMAPFILEHEADER* bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) pImage;
00319         BITMAPINFOHEADER* bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00320         BITMAPINFO* bitmapInfo=(BITMAPINFO *)bmpInfoHdr;
00321         
00322         /*
00323         int headersize = sizeof( BITMAPFILEHEADER ) + sizeof( BITMAPINFOHEADER );
00324         
00325         *datasize = headersize;
00326         
00327         long frameSize;
00328         long pitch;
00329         */
00330 
00331         bool _8bit = bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount == 8;
00332         bool _RLE = _8bit && bmpInfoHdr->biCompression==BI_RLE8;
00333         
00334         /*
00335         // Calc size needed
00336         if ( _RLE )
00337         {
00338                 frameSize = GetRLEBitSize( pImage );
00339         }
00340         else
00341         {
00342                 pitch = ((((bmpInfoHdr->biWidth * bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount)+31)&~31)>>3);
00343                 frameSize = pitch*bmpInfoHdr->biHeight;
00344         }
00345         *datasize += frameSize;
00346         
00347         // 8 bit has RGB quad data
00348         if ( _8bit )
00349                 *datasize += sizeof( RGBQUAD ) * 256;
00350         */
00351 
00352         // Alloc new block
00353         char* outputdata = destbuffer;
00354         char* pNewBits;
00355         
00356         // Copy the first frame's file header
00357         memcpy( outputdata, pImage, bmf->bfOffBits );
00358         
00359         // Set new header info
00360         BITMAPFILEHEADER* _bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) outputdata;
00361         BITMAPINFOHEADER* _bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&_bmf[1]);
00362         
00363         // Now decoded, no RLE decoding is needed
00364         if ( _RLE )
00365                 _bmpInfoHdr->biCompression = BI_RGB;
00366 
00367         // Location for destination bits
00368         pNewBits = outputdata + bmf->bfOffBits;
00369                 
00370         if ( _RLE )
00371         {
00372                 DecodeRLEBits( pImage, pNewBits );
00373         }
00374         else
00375         {
00376                 const char* pImageBits = pImage + bmf->bfOffBits;
00377                 memcpy( pNewBits, pImageBits, bmpInfoHdr->biSizeImage );
00378         }
00379 }

00382 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00383 // Name: Bitmap::CopyBitmapBits()
00384 // Desc: Copies the bits bits to the destination surface
00385 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00386 bool Bitmap::CopyBitmapBits( const char* pBMPHeader, DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc )
00387 {
00388         const char* pBitmap = NULL;
00389         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
00390         
00391         // Get info
00392         int width, height, bpp;
00393         Bitmap::GetBitmapInfo( pBMPHeader, width, height, bpp );
00394         Bitmap::GetBitmapBits( pBMPHeader, &pBitmap );
00395 
00396         // Pitches
00397         long  surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
00398         long  bmp_pitch=((((width*bpp)+31)&~31)>>3);
00399         
00400         // Set index
00401         const char* pBits = pBitmap + ( (height-1) * bmp_pitch );
00402         
00403         // Copy
00404         for ( int i = 0; i < height; i++ )
00405         {
00406                 memcpy( pSurface, pBits, bmp_pitch );
00407 
00408                 // Move pointers to next line
00409                 pBits -= bmp_pitch;
00410                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
00411         }
00412 
00413         return true;
00414 }

00416 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00417 // Name: Bitmap::FillSurfaceFromBitmap()
00418 // Desc: Make surface from bitmap data
00419 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00420 bool Bitmap::FillSurfaceFromBitmap( const char* pBMPHeader, DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, BYTE** pExtra )
00421 {
00422         // Bitmap info
00423         const char* pBits = NULL;
00424         Bitmap::GetBitmapBits( pBMPHeader, &pBits );
00425         int     iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight, iBitmapDepth;
00426         Bitmap::GetBitmapInfo( pBMPHeader, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight, iBitmapDepth );
00427         
00428         // Pitch
00429         int iSurfacePitch = (int) pDesc->lPitch;
00430 
00431         // Set the pixel format
00432         LPDDPIXELFORMAT ddpixelformat = &(pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat);
00433         PixelFormat pixelformat = GetPixelFormat( ddpixelformat );
00434 
00435         // Do the conversion
00436         switch( iBitmapDepth )
00437         {
00438         case 8 :
00439                 // =============
00440                 // 8 bit sources
00441                 // =============
00442                 
00443                 // Lookup table for conversion, if necessary
00444                 if ( (*pExtra) == NULL )
00445                 {
00446                         Bitmap::GeneratePaletteConversionTable( pDesc, pBMPHeader, pExtra );
00447                         //TRACE( _T("Loading color table for resource\n" ) );
00448                 }
00449 
00450                 return ConvertBitmap_8( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight, (*pExtra) );
00451                 
00452         case 16 :
00453 
00454 #ifdef _555_SOURCES
00455                 // ==============
00456                 // 16 bit sources
00457                 // ==============
00458                 
00459                 switch( pixelformat )
00460                 {
00461                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_555 :
00462                         // 16 bit to 16 bit (555) - copy directly
00463                         return CopyBitmapBits( pBMPHeader, pDesc );
00464                         
00465                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_565: // (tested)
00466                         // 16 bit to 16 bit (565)
00467                         return ConvertBitmap_16_555_16_565_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00468 
00469                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_32: // (tested)
00470                         // 16 bit to 32 bit
00471                         return ConvertBitmap_16_555_32_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00472 
00473                 case PIXELFORMAT_16:
00474                         // 16 bit to any bit type
00475                         return ConvertBitmap_16_555_16_XXX( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00476 
00477                 case PIXELFORMAT_32: // (tested)
00478                         // 16 bit to any 32 bit type
00479                         return ConvertBitmap_16_555_32_XXX( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00480                         
00481                 default :
00482                         assert( 0 && _T("Mode is not handled.") );
00483                         return false;
00484                 }
00485                 break;
00486 #else
00487                 // ==============
00488                 // 16 bit sources
00489                 // ==============
00490                 switch( pixelformat )
00491                 {
00492                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_565:
00493                         // 16 bit to 16 bit (565) - copy directly
00494                         return CopyBitmapBits( pBMPHeader, pDesc );
00495 
00496                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_555 :
00497                         // 16 bit to 16 bit (555)
00498                         return ConvertBitmap_16_565_16_555_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00499                                                 
00500                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_32: // (tested)
00501                         // 16 bit to 32 bit
00502                         return ConvertBitmap_16_565_32_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00503 
00504                 case PIXELFORMAT_16:
00505                         // 16 bit to any bit type
00506                         return ConvertBitmap_16_565_16_XXX( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00507 
00508                 case PIXELFORMAT_32: // (tested)
00509                         // 16 bit to any 32 bit type
00510                         return ConvertBitmap_16_565_32_XXX( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00511                         
00512                 default :
00513                         assert( 0 && _T("Mode is not handled.") );
00514                         return false;
00515                 }
00516                 break;
00517 #endif
00518 
00519         case 24:
00520                 // ==============
00521                 // 24 bit sources
00522                 // ==============
00523 
00524                 switch( pixelformat )
00525                 {
00526                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_555 :
00527                         // 24 bit to 16 bit (555)
00528                         return ConvertBitmap_24_16_555_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00529                 
00530                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_565 :
00531                         // 24 bit to 16 bit (565)
00532                         return ConvertBitmap_24_16_565_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00533                         
00534                 case PIXELFORMAT_RGB_32 :
00535                         // 24 bit to 32 bit
00536                         return ConvertBitmap_24_32_RGB( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00537                 
00538                 case PIXELFORMAT_16 :
00539                         // 24 bit to any 16 type
00540                         return ConvertBitmap_24_16_XXX( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00541 
00542                 case PIXELFORMAT_32 : 
00543                         // 24 bit to any 24 type
00544                         return ConvertBitmap_24_32_XXX( pDesc, pBits, iBitmapWidth, iBitmapHeight );
00545 
00546                 default : 
00547                         assert( 0 && _T("Mode is not handled.") );
00548                         return false;   
00549                 }
00550         default :
00551                 assert( 0 && _T("Mode is not handled.") );
00552                 return false;
00553         }
00554         
00555         // Create bits as needed
00556         return true;    
00557 }

00560 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00561 // Name: Bitmap() 
00562 // Desc: Gets the bitmap info
00563 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00564 void Bitmap::GetBitmapInfo(const char *inputData, int &width, int &height, int &bpp )
00565 {
00566         BITMAPFILEHEADER* bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) inputData;
00567         BITMAPINFOHEADER* bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00568         //BYTE* pBits = inputData + bmf->bfOffBits;
00569         
00570         // Size
00571         width = bmpInfoHdr->biWidth;
00572         height = bmpInfoHdr->biHeight;
00573         bpp = bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount;
00574 }

00576 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00577 // Name: Bitmap() 
00578 // Desc: Gets the bitmap bits
00579 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00580 void Bitmap::GetBitmapBits(const char *inputData, const char** bits)
00581 {
00582         BITMAPFILEHEADER* bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) inputData;
00583         BITMAPINFOHEADER* bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00584         (*bits) = inputData + bmf->bfOffBits;
00585 }

00588 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00589 // Name: Bitmap() 
00590 // Desc: Gets the pixel format from the surface
00591 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00592 Bitmap::PixelFormat Bitmap::GetPixelFormat( LPDDPIXELFORMAT ddpixelformat )
00593 {
00594         // Save the pixel format
00595         switch( ddpixelformat->dwRGBBitCount )
00596         {
00597         case 16 : 
00598                 // 16 bit - 555 or 565
00599                 if ( ddpixelformat->dwRBitMask == 0x7c00 &&  // 555 RGB
00600                          ddpixelformat->dwGBitMask == 0x03e0 && 
00601                          ddpixelformat->dwBBitMask == 0x1f )
00602                 {
00603                         return PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_555;
00604                 }
00605                 else if ( ddpixelformat->dwRBitMask == 0xf800 && 
00606                         ddpixelformat->dwGBitMask == 0x07e0 && 
00607                         ddpixelformat->dwBBitMask == 0x1f ) // 565 RGB
00608                 {
00609                         return PIXELFORMAT_RGB_16_565;
00610                 }
00611                 
00612                 //default
00613                 return PIXELFORMAT_16;
00614 
00615         case 32 : 
00616                 
00617                 // 32 bit - 888
00618                 if ( ddpixelformat->dwRBitMask == 0xff0000 &&  // 888 RGB
00619                         ddpixelformat->dwGBitMask == 0x00ff00 && 
00620                         ddpixelformat->dwBBitMask == 0x0000ff )
00621                 {
00622                         return PIXELFORMAT_RGB_32;
00623                 }
00624                 
00625                 // default
00626                 return PIXELFORMAT_32; 
00627 
00628         default : 
00629                 assert( 0 && "Invalid pixel format for surface (8,16,32 bit only)\n" );
00630                 break;
00631         }
00632 
00633         return PIXELFORMAT_UNKNOWN;
00634 }
00635 
00636 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00637 // Name: Bitmap() 
00638 // Desc: Generates the bitmap lookup table to convert bitmap palette indexes
00639 //               to real color values native to the color mode of the surface.
00640 //               Use the failsafe way, slow conversion, for all formats possible
00641 //               looking at the mask of the pixel formats, num bits, etc...
00642 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00643 bool Bitmap::GeneratePaletteConversionTable( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmap, BYTE** table )
00644 {
00645         BITMAPFILEHEADER* bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) bitmap;
00646         BITMAPINFOHEADER* bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
00647 
00648         // Is this a valid 8 bit bitmap?  If not, bail
00649         if ( bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount != 8 )
00650                 return false;
00651 
00652         // Get the colors
00653         RGBQUAD* colors =(RGBQUAD *)(((BYTE*)bmpInfoHdr)+bmpInfoHdr->biSize);
00654 
00655         // Declare conversion table
00656         int iBpp = pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount;
00657         int new_size = ( iBpp >> 3 ) << 8;
00658         BYTE* lookuptable = new BYTE[ new_size ];
00659                 
00660         // Amount to shift
00661         int iRShift = 0, iBShift = 0, iGShift = 0;
00662         int i;
00663         
00664         // Convert the colors
00665         switch( iBpp )
00666         {
00667         case 16 : // 16 bit conversion
00668                 {
00669                         int iRBits = 0, iBBits = 0, iGBits = 0;
00670                         WORD temp;
00671 
00672                         // Find amount to shift for red
00673                         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < iBpp; i++ )
00674                         {
00675                                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
00676                                 { iRShift = i; break; }
00677                                 temp <<= 1;
00678                         }
00679                         for ( ; i < iBpp; i++ )
00680                         {
00681                                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) )
00682                                         break;
00683                                 iRBits++;
00684                                 temp <<= 1;
00685                         }
00686                         
00687                         // Find amount to shift for green
00688                         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < iBpp; i++ )
00689                         {
00690                                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
00691                                 { iGShift = i; break; }
00692                                 temp <<= 1;
00693                         }
00694                         for ( ; i < iBpp; i++ )
00695                         {
00696                                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) )
00697                                         break;
00698                                 iGBits++;
00699                                 temp <<= 1;
00700                         }
00701                         
00702                         // Find amount to shift for blue
00703                         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < iBpp; i++ )
00704                         {
00705                                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) 
00706                                 { iBShift = i; break; }
00707                                 temp <<= 1;
00708                         }
00709                         for ( ; i < iBpp; i++ )
00710                         {
00711                                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) )
00712                                         break;
00713                                 iBBits++;
00714                                 temp <<= 1;
00715                         }
00716                         
00717                         // Convert!
00718                         WORD* index = (WORD*) lookuptable;
00719                         for ( int i = 0; i < 256; i++ )
00720                         {
00721                                 index[ i ] = 
00722                                         ( colors[ i ].rgbRed   >> ( 8 - iRBits ) << iRShift ) | // RED
00723                                         ( colors[ i ].rgbGreen >> ( 8 - iGBits ) << iGShift ) | // GREEN
00724                                         ( colors[ i ].rgbBlue  >> ( 8 - iBBits ) << iBShift ); // BLUE
00725                         }
00726                 }
00727                 break;
00728 
00729         case 32 : // 32 bit conversion
00730                 {
00731                         DWORD temp;
00732                         
00733                         // Find amount to shift for red
00734                         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < iBpp; i++ )
00735                         {
00736                                 if ( temp & (DWORD) pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
00737                                 { iRShift = i; break; }
00738                                 temp <<= 1;
00739                         }
00740                         
00741                         // Find amount to shift for green
00742                         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < iBpp; i++ )
00743                         {
00744                                 if ( temp & (DWORD) pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
00745                                 { iGShift = i; break; }
00746                                 temp <<= 1;
00747                         }
00748                         
00749                         // Find amount to shift for blue
00750                         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < iBpp; i++ )
00751                         {
00752                                 if ( temp & (DWORD) pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) 
00753                                 { iBShift = i; break; }
00754                                 temp <<= 1;
00755                         }
00756 
00757                         // Convert
00758                         DWORD* index = (DWORD*) lookuptable;
00759                         for ( int i = 0; i < 256; i++ )
00760                         {
00761                                 index[ i ] = 
00762                                         ( colors[ i ].rgbRed   << iRShift ) | // RED
00763                                         ( colors[ i ].rgbGreen << iGShift ) | // GREEN
00764                                         ( colors[ i ].rgbBlue  << iBShift ); // BLUE
00765                         }
00766                 }
00767                 break;
00768 
00769         default : 
00770                 assert( 0 && "Couldn't build palette, surface doesn't contain valid bpp info" );
00771                 break;
00772         }
00773 
00774         // Return data
00775         (*table) = lookuptable;
00776 
00777         return true;
00778 }
00779 
00780 // =============
00781 // 8 bit sources
00782 // =============
00783 
00784 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_8( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight, BYTE* pLookup )
00785 {
00786         // 8 bit to 16 bit, using the color translation table
00787         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
00788         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
00789         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
00790         
00791         // Pitches
00792         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*8)+31)&~31)>>3);
00793         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
00794         
00795         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
00796         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
00797         
00798         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
00799         BYTE* pSource = (BYTE*) pBitmap;
00800 
00801         // 16 bit conversion
00802         switch( pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount )
00803         {
00804         case 16 :
00805                 {
00806                         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
00807                         WORD* pTable = (WORD*) pLookup;
00808 
00809                         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
00810                         {
00811                                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
00812                                 {
00813                                         pDest[ j ] = pTable[ pBitmap[ j ] ];
00814                                 }
00815                                 
00816                                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
00817                                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
00818                                 
00819                                 // Move surface pointer to next line
00820                                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
00821                                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
00822                         }
00823                 }
00824                 break;
00825 
00826         case 32 :
00827                 {
00828                         DWORD* pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
00829                         DWORD* pTable = (DWORD*) pLookup;
00830                         
00831                         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
00832                         {
00833                                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
00834                                 {
00835                                         pDest[ j ] = pTable[ pSource[ j ] ];
00836                                 }
00837                                 
00838                                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
00839                                 pSource -= bmp_pitch;
00840                                 
00841                                 // Move surface pointer to next line
00842                                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
00843                                 pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
00844                         }
00845                         break;
00846                 }
00847 
00848         default : // failure
00849                 assert( 0 && "You should never get here" );
00850                 break;
00851         }
00852 
00853         return true;
00854 }
00855 
00856 // ==============
00857 // 16 bit sources
00858 // ==============
00859 
00860 #ifdef _555_SOURCES
00861 
00862 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_555_16_555_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
00863 {
00864         // 16 bit to 16 bit (555) - copy directly
00865         return false;
00866 }
00867 
00868 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_555_16_565_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
00869 {
00870         // 16 bit 555 to 16 bit 565 RGB
00871         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
00872         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
00873         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
00874 
00875         // Pitches
00876         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*16)+31)&~31)>>3);
00877         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
00878 
00879         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
00880         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
00881                 
00882         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
00883         WORD* pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
00884         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
00885         
00886         /*
00887         ========================================
00888         RGB 555 to RGB 565
00889         ========================================
00890         RED             5 to 5 bits, << 1
00891         GREEN   5 to 6 bits, << 1
00892         BLUE    5 to 5 bits,
00893         ========================================
00894         */
00895 
00896         const int ndoubles = iBitmapWidth >> 1;
00897         const int nsingles = iBitmapWidth % ndoubles;
00898 
00899         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
00900         {
00901                 DWORD * pDWordDest = (DWORD *)pDest;
00902                 DWORD * pDWordSrc = (DWORD *)pSource;
00903                 DWORD * pDestEnd = pDWordDest + ndoubles;
00904 
00905                 while (pDWordDest < pDestEnd)
00906                 {
00907                         *pDWordDest = 
00908                                 ( ( *pDWordSrc & 0x7fe07fe0 ) << 1 ) | 
00909                                 ( *pDWordSrc & 0x001f001f );
00910 
00911                         pDWordDest++;
00912                         pDWordSrc++;
00913                 }
00914 
00915                 if ( nsingles )
00916                 {
00917                         WORD* pWordDest = (WORD*) pDWordDest;
00918                         WORD* pWordSrc = (WORD*) pDWordSrc;
00919                         *pWordDest = 
00920                                 ( ( *pWordSrc & 0x7fe0 ) << 1 ) | 
00921                                 ( *pWordSrc & 0x001f );
00922                 }
00923 
00924                 /* Original
00925                 
00926                 //Must be WORD aligned...
00927                 for (int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++)
00928                 {
00929                         pDest[ j ] = 
00930                                 ( ( pSource[ j ] & 0x7fe0 ) << 1 ) | 
00931                                 ( pSource[ j ] & 0x1f );
00932                 }
00933                 
00934                 */
00935 
00936                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
00937                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
00938                 pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
00939                 
00940                 // Move surface pointer to next line
00941                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
00942                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
00943         }
00944 
00945         return true;
00946 }
00947 
00948 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_555_32_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
00949 {
00950         // 16 bit 555 to 32 bit RGB
00951         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
00952         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
00953         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
00954 
00955         // Pitches
00956         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*16)+31)&~31)>>3);
00957         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
00958 
00959         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
00960         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
00961                 
00962         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
00963         WORD* pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
00964         DWORD* pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
00965 
00966         /*
00967         ========================================
00968         RGB 555 to RGB 0888
00969         ========================================
00970         RED             5 to 8 bits, << 16 + 3 - 10
00971         GREEN   5 to 8 bits, << 8 + 3 - 5
00972         BLUE    5 to 8 bits, << 3
00973 
00974         This leaves three empty bits that need
00975         to be filled with something. We will
00976         fill those with the three most
00977         significant bits of the 5 bit value.
00978         Added 4-4-02 -JES
00979         
00980         So for those 3 bits:
00981         RED             << 16 - 2 - 10
00982         GREEN   << 8  - 2 - 5
00983         BLUE    << 0  - 2 - 0
00984         ========================================
00985         */
00986         DWORD color, temp;
00987 
00988         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; ++i )
00989         {
00990                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; ++j )
00991                 {
00992                         color = pSource[ j ];
00993                         
00994                         /* Original
00995                         temp = (color & 0x7c00) << 9;   //Set high blue bits from all blue bits...
00996                         temp |= (color & 0x7000) << 4;  //Set low blue bits from high blue bits...
00997 
00998                         temp |= ( color & 0x3e0 ) << 6; //Set high green bits from all green bits...
00999                         temp |= ( color & 0x380 ) << 1; //Set low green bits from high green bits...
01000 
01001                         temp |= ( color & 0x1f ) << 3;  //Set high red bits from all red bits...
01002                         temp |= ( color & 0x1c ) >> 2;  //Set low red bits from high red bits...
01003 
01004                         /*Alternate #1...
01005                         temp = (color & 0x7c00) << 9;   //Set high blue bits from all blue bits...
01006                         temp |= (color & 0x1FE0) << 5;  //Set low blue bits from low blue bits,
01007                                                                                         //Set high green bits from all green bits...
01008                         temp |= (color & 0x00FF) << 3;  //Set low green bits from low green bits,
01009                                                                                         //Set high red bits from all red bits...
01010                         temp |= (color & 0x0007);               //Set low red bits from low red bits.
01011                         */
01012 
01013                         /*Alternate #2...*/
01014                         temp = ((color & 0x7c00) << 9)  //Set blue bits...
01015                                 |  ((color & 0x03E0) << 6)      //Set green bits...
01016                                 |  ((color & 0x001F) << 3);     //Set red bits...
01017 
01018                         //Replicate the high bits into the low bits...
01019                         temp |= (temp & 0x00E0E0E0) >> 5;       //Set the low bits of each color from
01020                                                                                                 //the high bits.
01021                         
01022 
01023                         pDest[ j ] = temp;
01024                 }
01025                 
01026                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01027                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01028                 pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01029                 
01030                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01031                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01032                 pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01033         }
01034         return true;
01035 }
01036 
01037 // Non-optimal
01038 
01039 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_555_16_XXX( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01040 {
01041         // 16 bit 555 to 16 bit 565 RGB
01042         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01043         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01044         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01045 
01046         // Pitches
01047         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*16)+31)&~31)>>3);
01048         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01049 
01050         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01051         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01052                 
01053         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01054         WORD* pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01055         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01056         WORD temp;
01057 
01058         // Amount to shift
01059         int iRShift = 0, iBShift = 0, iGShift = 0;
01060         int iRBits = 0, iBBits = 0, iGBits = 0;
01061         int i;
01062         
01063         // Find amount to shift for red
01064         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 16; i++ )
01065         {
01066                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
01067                 { iRShift = i; break; }
01068                 temp <<= 1;
01069         }
01070         for ( ; i < 16; i++ )
01071         {
01072                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) )
01073                         break;
01074                 iRBits++;
01075                 temp <<= 1;
01076         }
01077         
01078         // Find amount to shift for green
01079         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 16; i++ )
01080         {
01081                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
01082                 { iGShift = i; break; }
01083                 temp <<= 1;
01084         }
01085         for ( ; i < 16; i++ )
01086         {
01087                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) )
01088                         break;
01089                 iGBits++;
01090                 temp <<= 1;
01091         }
01092         
01093         // Find amount to shift for blue
01094         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 16; i++ )
01095         {
01096                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) 
01097                 { iBShift = i; break; }
01098                 temp <<= 1;
01099         }
01100         for ( ; i < 16; i++ )
01101         {
01102                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) )
01103                         break;
01104                 iBBits++;
01105                 temp <<= 1;
01106         }
01107         
01108         /*
01109         =============================================
01110         RGB 555 to xxx xxx
01111         =============================================
01112         RED             5 to R bits, >> 10 << R shift
01113         GREEN   5 to G bits, >> 5 << G shift
01114         BLUE    5 to B bits, >> 0 << B shift
01115         =============================================
01116         */
01117         
01118         // Account for converting from 5 to 6 bits
01119         iRShift += iRBits - 5;
01120         iGShift += iGBits - 5;
01121         iBShift += iBBits - 5;
01122 
01123         for ( i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01124         {
01125                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
01126                 {
01127                         pDest[ j ] =
01128                                 ( ( ( pSource[ j ] & 0x7c00 ) >> 10 ) << iRShift ) | // red
01129                                 ( ( ( pSource[ j ] & 0x3e0 ) >> 5 ) << iGShift ) |       // green
01130                                 ( ( pSource[ j ] & 0x1f ) << iBShift );                          // blue
01131                 }
01132                 
01133                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01134                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01135                 pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01136                 
01137                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01138                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01139                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01140         }
01141         return true;
01142 }
01143 
01144 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_555_32_XXX( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01145 {
01146         // 16 bit 555 to 32 bit xxxx xxx
01147         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01148         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01149         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01150 
01151         // Pitches
01152         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*16)+31)&~31)>>3);
01153         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01154 
01155         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01156         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01157                 
01158         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01159         WORD* pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01160         DWORD* pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01161         DWORD temp;
01162         
01163         // Amount to shift
01164         int iRShift(0), iBShift(0), iGShift(0); // added initialization values for iRShift & iBShift -taj
01165         int i;
01166         DWORD color;
01167         
01168         // Find amount to shift for red
01169         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
01170         {
01171                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
01172                 { iRShift = i; break; }
01173                 temp <<= 1;
01174         }
01175         
01176         // Find amount to shift for green
01177         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
01178         {
01179                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
01180                 { iGShift = i; break; }
01181                 temp <<= 1;
01182         }
01183         
01184         // Find amount to shift for blue
01185         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
01186         {
01187                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) 
01188                 { iBShift = i; break; }
01189                 temp <<= 1;
01190         }
01191 
01192         /*
01193         =============================================
01194         RGB 555 to 888 xxx
01195         =============================================
01196         RED             5 to R bits, >> 10 << R shift
01197         GREEN   5 to G bits, >> 5 << G shift
01198         BLUE    5 to B bits, >> 0 << B shift
01199 
01200         This leaves three empty bits that need
01201         to be filled with something. We will
01202         fill those with the three most
01203         significant bits of the 5 bit value.
01204         Added 4-4-02 -JES
01205         =============================================
01206         */
01207 
01208         // Account for shifting of 5 bit source to 8 bit
01209         int const iRShift5To8 = iRShift + 3;
01210         int const iBShift5To8 = iBShift + 3;
01211         int const iGShift5To8 = iGShift + 3;
01212 
01213         for ( i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; ++i )
01214         {
01215                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; ++j )
01216                 {
01217                         color = pSource[ j ];
01218                         
01219                         temp = ( (color & 0x7c00) >> 10 ) << iRShift5To8;
01220                         temp |= ( (color & 0x7000) >> 12 ) << iRShift;
01221 
01222                         temp |= ( ( color & 0x3e0 ) >> 5 ) << iGShift5To8;
01223                         temp |= ( ( color & 0x380 ) >> 7 ) << iGShift;
01224 
01225                         temp |= ( color & 0x1f ) << iBShift5To8;
01226                         temp |= ( ( color & 0x1c ) >> 2 ) << iBShift;
01227 
01228                         pDest[ j ] = temp;
01229                 }
01230                 
01231                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01232                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01233                 pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01234                 
01235                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01236                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01237                 pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01238         }
01239         return true;
01240 }
01241 
01242 #else
01243 
01244 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_565_16_555_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01245 {
01246         // 16 bit 555 to 16 bit 565 RGB
01247         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01248         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01249         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01250 
01251         // Pitches
01252         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*16)+31)&~31)>>3);
01253         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01254 
01255         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01256         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01257                 
01258         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01259         WORD* pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01260         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01261         
01262         /*
01263         ========================================
01264         RGB 565 to RGB 555
01265         ========================================
01266         */
01267 
01268         const int ndoubles = iBitmapWidth >> 1;
01269         const int nsingles = iBitmapWidth % ndoubles;
01270 
01271         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01272         {
01273                 DWORD * pDWordDest = (DWORD *)pDest;
01274                 DWORD * pDWordSrc = (DWORD *)pSource;
01275                 DWORD * pDestEnd = pDWordDest + ndoubles;
01276 
01277                 while (pDWordDest < pDestEnd)
01278                 {
01279                         *pDWordDest = 
01280                                 ( ( *pDWordSrc & 0xffc0ffc0 ) >> 1 ) | 
01281                                 ( *pDWordSrc & 0x001f001f );
01282 
01283                         pDWordDest++;
01284                         pDWordSrc++;
01285                 }
01286 
01287                 if ( nsingles )
01288                 {
01289                         WORD* pWordDest = (WORD*) pDWordDest;
01290                         WORD* pWordSrc = (WORD*) pDWordSrc;
01291                         *pWordDest = 
01292                                 ( ( *pWordSrc & 0xffc0 ) >> 1 ) | 
01293                                 ( *pWordSrc & 0x001f );
01294                 }
01295 
01296                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01297                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01298                 pSource = (WORD*) pBitmap;
01299                 
01300                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01301                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01302                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01303         }
01304 
01305         return true;
01306 }

01323 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_565_16_XXX( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )

01328 
01329         
01330 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_16_565_32_XXX( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01331 {
01332         assert( 0 && "Not implemented" );
01333         return false;
01334 }
01335 
01336 #endif
01337 
01338 // ==============
01339 // 24 bit sources
01340 // ==============
01341 
01342 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_24_16_555_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01343 {
01344         // 24 bit to 16 bit 555 RGB
01345         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01346         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01347         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01348         
01349         // Pitches
01350         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth* 24)+31)&~31)>>3);
01351         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01352         
01353         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01354         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01355         
01356         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01357         BYTE* pSource = (BYTE*) pBitmap;
01358         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01359         
01360         /*
01361         ========================================
01362         BGR 888 to RGB 555
01363         ========================================
01364         RED             8 to 5 bits, >> 3 << 11 
01365         GREEN   8 to 5 bits, >> 3 << 5
01366         BLUE    8 to 5 bits, >> 3
01367         ========================================
01368         */
01369 
01370         const int doubles( iBitmapWidth / 2 );
01371         const int singles( iBitmapWidth % 2 );
01372 
01373         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01374         {
01375                 WORD* pDestEnd = pDest + ( doubles << 1 );
01376                 while ( pDest < pDestEnd )
01377                 {
01378                         pDest[ 0 ] =
01379                                 ( ( pSource[ 2 ] & 0xf8 ) << 7 ) | // RED
01380                                 ( ( pSource[ 1 ] & 0xf8 ) << 2 ) | // GREEN
01381                                 ( ( pSource[ 0 ] & 0xf8 ) >> 3 );  // BLUE
01382                         pDest[ 1 ] =
01383                                 ( ( pSource[ 5 ] & 0xf8 ) << 7 ) | // RED
01384                                 ( ( pSource[ 4 ] & 0xf8 ) << 2 ) | // GREEN
01385                                 ( ( pSource[ 3 ] & 0xf8 ) >> 3 );  // BLUE
01386                         pSource += 6;
01387                         pDest+=2;
01388                 }
01389 
01390                 if ( singles )
01391                 {
01392                         pDest[ 0 ] =
01393                                 ( ( pSource[ 2 ] & 0xf8 ) << 7 ) | // RED
01394                                 ( ( pSource[ 1 ] & 0xf8 ) << 2 ) | // GREEN
01395                                 ( ( pSource[ 0 ] & 0xf8 ) >> 3 );  // BLUE
01396                 }
01397                 
01398                 
01399                 /*
01400                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
01401                 {
01402                         pDest[ j ] =
01403                                 ( ( pSource[ 2 ] & 0xf8 ) << 7 ) | // RED
01404                                 ( ( pSource[ 1 ] & 0xf8 ) << 2 ) | // GREEN
01405                                 ( ( pSource[ 0 ] & 0xf8 ) >> 3 );  // BLUE
01406                         pSource += 3;
01407                 }
01408                 */
01409 
01410                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01411                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01412                 pSource = pBitmap;
01413                 
01414                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01415                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01416                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01417         }
01418 
01419         return true;
01420 }
01421 
01422 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_24_16_565_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01423 {
01424         // 24 bit to 16 bit 565 RGB
01425         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01426         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01427         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01428 
01429         // Pitches
01430         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth* 24)+31)&~31)>>3);
01431         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01432 
01433         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01434         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01435                 
01436         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01437         BYTE* pSource = (BYTE*) pBitmap;
01438         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01439         
01440         
01441         /*
01442         ========================================
01443         BGR 888 to RGB 565
01444         ========================================
01445         RED             8 to 5 bits, >> 3 << 11 
01446         GREEN   8 to 6 bits, >> 2 << 5
01447         BLUE    8 to 5 bits, >> 3
01448         ========================================
01449         */
01450 
01451         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01452         {
01453                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
01454                 {
01455                         pDest[ j ] =
01456                                 ( ( pSource[ 2 ] & 0xf8 ) << 8 ) | 
01457                                 ( ( pSource[ 1 ] & 0xfc ) << 3 ) |
01458                                 ( ( pSource[ 0 ] & 0xf8 ) >> 3 );
01459                         pSource += 3;
01460                 }
01461 
01462                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01463                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01464                 pSource = pBitmap;
01465                 
01466                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01467                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01468                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01469         }
01470 
01471         return true;
01472 }
01473 
01474 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_24_32_RGB( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01475 {
01476         // 24 bit to 32 bit 0888 RGB
01477         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01478         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01479         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01480 
01481         // Pitches
01482         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth* 24)+31)&~31)>>3);
01483         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01484 
01485         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01486         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01487                 
01488         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01489         BYTE* pSource = (BYTE*) pBitmap;
01490         DWORD* pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01491         
01492         /*
01493         ========================================
01494         BGR 888 to RGB 0888
01495         ========================================
01496         RED             8 bits << 16
01497         GREEN   8 bits << 8
01498         BLUE    8 bits
01499         ========================================
01500         */
01501 
01502         for ( int i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01503         {
01504                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
01505                 {
01506                         pDest[ j ] = 
01507                         ( pSource[ 2 ] << 16 ) |        // RED
01508                         ( pSource[ 1 ] << 8 ) |         // GREEN
01509                         ( pSource[ 0 ] );                       // BLUE
01510                         pSource += 3;
01511                 }
01512                 
01513                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01514                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01515                 pSource = pBitmap;
01516                 
01517                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01518                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01519                 pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01520         }
01521         return true;
01522 }
01523 
01524 // Non-optimal
01525 
01526 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_24_16_XXX( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01527 {
01528         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01529         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01530         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01531         
01532         // Pitches
01533         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth* 24)+31)&~31)>>3);
01534         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01535         
01536         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
01537         pBitmap += bmp_pitch * ( iBitmapHeight - 1 );
01538         
01539         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
01540         BYTE* pSource = (BYTE*) pBitmap;
01541         WORD* pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01542         WORD temp;
01543         
01544         // Amount to shift
01545         int iRShift = 0, iBShift = 0, iGShift = 0;
01546         int iRBits = 0, iBBits = 0, iGBits = 0;
01547         int i;
01548         
01549         // Find amount to shift for red
01550         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 16; i++ )
01551         {
01552                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
01553                 { iRShift = i; break; }
01554                 temp <<= 1;
01555         }
01556         for ( ; i < 16; i++ )
01557         {
01558                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) )
01559                         break;
01560                 iRBits++;
01561                 temp <<= 1;
01562         }
01563         
01564         // Find amount to shift for green
01565         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 16; i++ )
01566         {
01567                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
01568                 { iGShift = i; break; }
01569                 temp <<= 1;
01570         }
01571         for ( ; i < 16; i++ )
01572         {
01573                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) )
01574                         break;
01575                 iGBits++;
01576                 temp <<= 1;
01577         }
01578         
01579         // Find amount to shift for blue
01580         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 16; i++ )
01581         {
01582                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) 
01583                 { iBShift = i; break; }
01584                 temp <<= 1;
01585         }
01586         for ( ; i < 16; i++ )
01587         {
01588                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) )
01589                         break;
01590                 iBBits++;
01591                 temp <<= 1;
01592         }
01593                   
01594         /*
01595         =============================================
01596         BGR 888 to xxx xxx
01597         =============================================
01598         RED             8 to R bits, >> 8 - R bits << R shift
01599         GREEN   8 to G bits, >> 8 - G bits << G shift
01600         BLUE    8 to B bits, >> 8 - B bits << B shift
01601         =============================================
01602         */
01603 
01604         for ( i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01605         {
01606                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
01607                 {
01608                         pDest[ j ] =
01609                                 ( pSource[ 2 ] >> ( 8 - iRBits ) << iRShift ) | // RED
01610                                 ( pSource[ 1 ] >> ( 8 - iGBits ) << iGShift ) | // GREEN
01611                                 ( pSource[ 0 ] >> ( 8 - iBBits ) << iBShift ); // BLUE
01612                         pSource += 3;
01613                 }
01614                 
01615                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01616                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01617                 pSource = pBitmap;
01618                 
01619                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01620                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01621                 pDest = (WORD*) pSurface;
01622         }
01623         return true;
01624 }

01638

01641         DWORD* pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01642         DWORD temp;

01646         int iRBits = 0, iBBits = 0, iGBits = 0;
01647         int i;
01648         
01649         // Find amount to shift for red
01650         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
01651         {
01652                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
01653                 { iRShift = i; break; }
01654                 temp <<= 1;
01655         }
01656         for ( ; i < 32; i++ )
01657         {
01658                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) )
01659                         break;
01660                 iRBits++;
01661                 temp <<= 1;
01662         }
01663         
01664         // Find amount to shift for green
01665         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
01666         {
01667                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
01668                 { iGShift = i; break; }
01669                 temp <<= 1;
01670         }

01672         {

01674                         break;

01683                 { iBShift = i; break; }
01684                 temp <<= 1;
01685         }
01686         for ( ; i < 32; i++ )
01687         {
01688                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) )
01689                         break;
01690                 iBBits++;
01691                 temp <<= 1;
01692         }
01693                   
01694         /*
01695         =============================================
01696         BGR 888 to xxx 0888
01697         =============================================
01698         RED             8 to 8 bits, << R shift
01699         GREEN   8 to 8 bits, << G shift
01700         BLUE    8 to 8 bits, << B shift
01701         =============================================
01702         */
01703 
01704         for ( i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
01705         {
01706                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
01707                 {
01708                         pDest[ j ] =
01709                                 ( pSource[ 2 ] << iRShift ) | // RED
01710                                 ( pSource[ 1 ] << iGShift ) | // GREEN
01711                                 ( pSource[ 0 ] << iBShift ); // BLUE
01712                         pSource += 3;
01713                 }
01714                 
01715                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
01716                 pBitmap -= bmp_pitch;
01717                 pSource = pBitmap;
01718                 
01719                 // Move surface pointer to next line
01720                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
01721                 pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
01722         }

01990 bool Bitmap::ConvertBitmap_32_32_XXX( DDSURFACEDESC2* pDesc, const char* bitmapBits, int iBitmapWidth, int iBitmapHeight )
01991 {
01992         BYTE* pBitmap = (BYTE*) bitmapBits;
01993         BYTE* pSurface = (BYTE*) pDesc->lpSurface;
01994         assert( iBitmapHeight > 0  && "Bottom-up bitmap expected" );
01995         
01996         // Pitches
01997         long bmp_pitch=((((iBitmapWidth*24)+31)&~31)>>3);
01998         long surface_pitch = pDesc->lPitch;
01999         
02000         // Adjust for upside-down, start at last line of bitmap
02001         pBitmap -= bmp_pitch * iBitmapHeight;
02002         
02003         // Temp pointers for easy color reading
02004         BYTE* pSource = (BYTE*) pBitmap;
02005         DWORD* pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
02006         DWORD temp;
02007         
02008         // Amount to shift
02009         int iRShift = 0, iBShift = 0, iGShift = 0;
02010         int iRBits = 0, iBBits = 0, iGBits = 0;
02011         int i;
02012         
02013         // Find amount to shift for red
02014         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
02015         {
02016                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) 
02017                 { iRShift = i; break; }
02018                 temp <<= 1;
02019         }
02020         for ( ; i < 32; i++ )
02021         {
02022                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwRBitMask ) )
02023                         break;
02024                 iRBits++;
02025                 temp <<= 1;
02026         }
02027         
02028         // Find amount to shift for green
02029         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
02030         {
02031                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) 
02032                 { iGShift = i; break; }
02033                 temp <<= 1;
02034         }
02035         for ( ; i < 32; i++ )
02036         {
02037                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwGBitMask ) )
02038                         break;
02039                 iGBits++;
02040                 temp <<= 1;
02041         }
02042         
02043         // Find amount to shift for blue
02044         for ( i = 0, temp = 1; i < 32; i++ )
02045         {
02046                 if ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) 
02047                 { iBShift = i; break; }
02048                 temp <<= 1;
02049         }
02050         for ( ; i < 32; i++ )
02051         {
02052                 if ( ! ( temp & pDesc->ddpfPixelFormat.dwBBitMask ) )
02053                         break;
02054                 iBBits++;
02055                 temp <<= 1;
02056         }
02057                   
02058         /*
02059         =============================================
02060         ABGR 8888 to xxx 0888
02061         =============================================
02062         RED             8 to 8 bits, << R shift
02063         GREEN   8 to 8 bits, << G shift
02064         BLUE    8 to 8 bits, << B shift
02065         =============================================
02066         */
02067 
02068         for ( i = 0; i < iBitmapHeight; i++ )
02069         {
02070                 for ( int j = 0; j < iBitmapWidth; j++ )
02071                 {
02072                         pDest[ j ] =
02073                                 ( pSource[ 3 ] << iRShift ) | // RED
02074                                 ( pSource[ 1 ] << iGShift ) | // GREEN
02075                                 ( pSource[ 2 ] << iBShift ); // BLUE
02076                         pSource += 3;
02077                 }
02078                 
02079                 // Move bitmap pointer to next line
02080                 pBitmap += bmp_pitch;
02081                 pSource = pBitmap;
02082                 
02083                 // Move surface pointer to next line
02084                 pSurface += surface_pitch;
02085                 pDest = (DWORD*) pSurface;
02086         }
02087         return true;
02088 }
02089 
02090 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02091 // Name: Bitmap::MakeSingleBitmap()
02092 // Desc: Make a single bitmap given a string of frames
02093 //               and allocating a new buffer in ram to store the new bitmap.
02094 //               This returns the pointer to the new ram and also sets datasize
02095 //               to the size of the new buffer
02096 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02097 const char* Bitmap::MakeSingleBitmap(const char* inputdata, int startFrame, int numFrames, int totalFrames, int *datasize )
02098 {
02099         // The image is at the start of the buffer + the frame offset
02100         int* pOffset = (int*) inputdata;
02101         const char* pImage = inputdata + ( ( totalFrames == 1 ) ? 0 : pOffset[startFrame] );
02102 
02103         BITMAPFILEHEADER* bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) pImage;
02104         BITMAPINFOHEADER* bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&bmf[1]);
02105         BITMAPINFO* bitmapInfo=(BITMAPINFO *)bmpInfoHdr;
02106 
02107         int infosize= bmpInfoHdr->biSize;
02108         assert( infosize == sizeof( BITMAPINFOHEADER ) );
02109 
02110         int headersize = sizeof( BITMAPFILEHEADER ) + sizeof( BITMAPINFOHEADER );
02111 
02112         *datasize = headersize;
02113 
02114         long frameSize;
02115         long pitch;
02116 
02117         bool _8bit = bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount == 8;
02118         bool _RLE = _8bit && bmpInfoHdr->biCompression==BI_RLE8;
02119 
02120         // If the total #frames is one, then
02121         // there is no need to crate a copy of this
02122         if (totalFrames == 1 && !_RLE )
02123         {
02124                 // Just return the original
02125                 return inputdata;
02126         }
02127 
02128         // Calc size needed
02129         if ( _RLE )
02130         {
02131                 frameSize = GetRLEBitSize( pImage );
02132         }
02133         else
02134         {
02135                 pitch = ((((bmpInfoHdr->biWidth * bmpInfoHdr->biBitCount)+31)&~31)>>3);
02136                 frameSize = pitch*bmpInfoHdr->biHeight;
02137         }
02138         *datasize += frameSize * numFrames;
02139         
02140         // 8 bit has RGB quad data
02141         if ( _8bit )
02142                 *datasize += sizeof( RGBQUAD ) * 256;
02143         
02144         // Alloc new block
02145         char* outputdata = new char[ *datasize ];
02146         const char* pImageBits;
02147         char* pNewBits = outputdata;
02148         
02149         // Copy the first frame's file header
02150         memcpy( outputdata, pImage, bmf->bfOffBits );
02151 
02152         // Set new height of the bitmap
02153         BITMAPFILEHEADER* _bmf=(BITMAPFILEHEADER *) outputdata;
02154         _bmf->bfSize = headersize + frameSize * numFrames;
02155         BITMAPINFOHEADER* _bmpInfoHdr=(BITMAPINFOHEADER *)(&_bmf[1]);
02156         _bmpInfoHdr->biHeight *= numFrames;
02157         _bmpInfoHdr->biSizeImage = frameSize * numFrames;
02158                 
02159         // Now decoded, no RLE decoding is needed
02160         if ( _RLE )
02161                 _bmpInfoHdr->biCompression = BI_RGB;
02162 
02163         BITMAPFILEHEADER* imgHeader;
02164 
02165         // Set new image pointer
02166         pNewBits = outputdata + bmf->bfOffBits;
02167 
02168         // Loop for each frame
02169         int endFrame = startFrame + numFrames - 1;
02170         for ( int i = endFrame; i >= startFrame; i-- )
02171         {
02172                 pImage = inputdata + ( ( totalFrames == 1 ) ? 0 : pOffset[i] );
02173 
02174                 if ( _RLE )
02175                 {
02176                         DecodeRLEBits( pImage, pNewBits );
02177                 }
02178                 else
02179                 {
02180                         imgHeader = (BITMAPFILEHEADER *) pImage;
02181                         pImageBits = pImage + imgHeader->bfOffBits;
02182                         memcpy( pNewBits, pImageBits, bmpInfoHdr->biSizeImage );
02183                 }
02184 
02185                 pNewBits += frameSize;
02186         }
02187 
02188         return outputdata;
02189 }
